Content-Type: text/plain;

Oliver,

I used Dryad in this paper: 
http://jeffclune.com/publications/201=
2-CluneEtAl-OntegenyRecapitulatesPhylogeny-AmNat.pdf

and had a good experi=
ence with it. I plan to use it in all my future papers to archive data/sour=
ce code/videos/supplementary material, etc. A lot of biology journals and t=
he NSF are requiring this practice, and I support the move. 


Best regards=
,
Jeff Clune

Assistant Professor
Computer Science
University of Wyoming
jc=
lune@...
jeffclune.com

On Jan 6, 2013, at 4:33 PM, Oliver Coleman <ol=
iver.coleman@...> wrote:

> 
> Hi all,
> 
> Does anyone know of a sit=
e where one can dump the exact software used for a published set of experim=
ents (rather than providing a link to a site that may or may not still cont=
ain the software or particular version that was used), all the relevant con=
figuration files and other input, and perhaps the output/results produced c=
orresponding to the published results?
> 
> Cheers,
> Oliver
> 
> 
> 


--Apple-Mail=_41201D98-A707-43EA-B026-53A571E2029C
